page.title: 15STALLINGTON HOSPITAL
page.content: Stallington Hospital,an old General Hospital of 1925,was once a private house.People are employed to look after the 413 patients.Visitors are always welcome.There are no children now,so two wards and the school are closed.False fire alarms are common,but never a fire.Each week 4 wards have fire-practice on Wednesday at 10am.The qualifications are the same as a normal nurses.Fulltime work is 37.5hours,while part time is 12 hours.Nurses are always busy talking to patients.On Tuesdays patients go to Shelton Swimming Pool.In the halls are Bingo and Physical Training.There is a cricket club, football pitch, tennis courts and the most popular, horseriding.Stallington is a large institution connected with St.Edward's, Cheddleton.
